interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/02/03
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Niall MacCormick'], 'Producers': ['Helen Gregory'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
Review Text: I recently read many of Trollope' s novels and was thrilled to see that a theatrical adaptation was available.  Yes the movie has some slight changes, but it is a great representation of Trollope' s work.  If you have not exposed yourself to his writing, it can be confusing at first, but all is made clear by the conclusion.  The movie was the same.  I felt as if I read the book for a second time.  Excellent
Review Title: Like Both Book and Movie
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Alpha House
Comedy, Drama
["An Amazon Original series: They work in the Senate. They live in the house - Alpha House. Created by Garry Trudeau (Doonesbury, Tanner '88)."]
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch'], 'Directors': ['Adam Bernstein', 'Michael Mayer', 'Andrew McCarthy', 'Bob Balaban', 'Jann Turner', 'Jake Schreier', 'Antoine Douaihy', 'Clark Johnson', 'Michael Pressman'], 'Producers': ['Jonathan Alter']}
I do not like politics in real life.  But this clever show makes me laugh because I think it might be closer to the truth than politicians will admit.
Funny pokes at politics
Justified
Suspense, Western, Drama, Action
["Deputy US Marshal Raylan Givens (Timothy Olyphant) will start to pick at the thread of a cold case over 30 years in the making, unraveling a riddle that echoes all the way back to his boyhood and his criminal father's bad dealings. Meanwhile, Boyd Crowder (Walton Goggins) finds his grip on Harlan loosening due to a Pentecostal preacher with a penchant for theatrics and a knack for manipulation..."]
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adam Arkin', 'Jon Avnet', 'Peter Werner', 'Michael Dinner', 'John Dahl', 'Bill Johnson', 'Michael W. Watkins', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Don Kurt', 'Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Fred Golan', 'Sarah Timberman', 'Carl Beverly', 'Michael Dinner', 'Graham Yost', 'Elmore Leonard']}
I enjoy westerners.  Justified is a modern day cowboy tale.  Even some of the bad guys are loveable and others are just plain fun to hate.  Every once in awhile, I find myself boo and hissing at events.
love the modern day cowboy
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Starzak', 'Christopher Sadler', 'Jay Grace', 'Lee Wilton', 'Seamus Malone', 'Jean-Philippe Vine', 'Richard Webber', 'Will Becher', 'Mike Mort', 'Dave Osmand'], 'Starring': ['John Sparkes', 'Justin Fletcher', 'Kate Harbour'], 'Studio': ['Aardman Animations']}
Love Shaun the Sheep.  He IA always thinking.  He doesn't miss a beat, I hope you will be able to meet, Shaun the Sheep.  I love Shirley and Timmy too
Dont miss a beat, come watch Shaun the Sheep

Ok, I hate it when a great pilot is shown, gets great reviews and isn't picked up.  This is a GREAT  story.  I love the blend of city and country settings, I like the characters, and I want to know what happens to brothers, cousins, and grandparents.  More, more, more please !!
I Want To Know What's Next

I recently read many of Trollope' s novels and was thrilled to see that a theatrical adaptation was available.  Yes the movie has some slight changes, but it is a great representation of Trollope' s work.  If you have not exposed yourself to his writing, it can be confusing at first, but all is made clear by the conclusion.  The movie was the same.  I felt as if I read the book for a second time. profile:
User Preferences Summary:

- **Genres**: The user continues to favor comedy and drama, particularly satire and clever political humor. Their recent engagement with Westerns and suspense dramas has expanded their interest in narrative-driven genres. A noted appreciation for adaptations of literary works highlights a preference for stories with rich narratives, while growing interest in animated content showcases their openness to diverse storytelling formats.

- **Tone**: They enjoy narratives that balance humor with critical takes on serious themes such as politics and morality. Interest in character dynamics, including lovable villains and moral complexities, persists across genres, including animation and adaptations of classic literature.

- **Content Sensitivity**: Engages comfortably with mature themes, valuing gritty storytelling that entertains while providing depth. This applies to animated and family-oriented content that resonates with mature audiences.

- **Viewing Purpose**: The user seeks entertainment that is both amusing and reflects real-world issues. They prefer narratives offering social commentary and evoking emotions like tension, humor, and introspection.

- **Engagement Style**: They exhibit enthusiasm for clever writing and robust character arcs, consistently rating quality narratives positively. A recent high rating for an adaptation underscores their strong investment in character-driven storytelling, especially when exploring familial relationships and complex settings. Their engagement with adaptations of classic literature reflects a preference for insightful, emotionally engaging storytelling that challenges and entertains.
